Speaking to ground staff its apparent that delays are frequent due to mechanical issues with old aircraft. Return flight also delayed by 1 hour. According to pilot the aircraft in JNB also non operational and requiring replacement. As before old aircraft tatty condition. Poor reliability.

Flew from Jo'burg to Victoria Falls in Zim. BA check in was very smooth and efficient. Turns out the BA lounge is not open during the day and we were directed to a third party lounge which was very nice indeed (better that the Galleries lounge that BA operate). We had to take a bus to get to our plane which was fine and efficiently done. The plane was an old BA badged 737-400 I suspect a reject from European operations. But plane was clean and well presented. We were given a choice of hot meals which I have to say was very tasty and well presented on the outbound leg. The inbound was not quite as nice but still acceptable. Both flights were packed to rafters with not a seat spare but staff coped very well. It would be good to see Comair get some new planes as the old cast offs from BA are really showing their age now.

BA 6275 1 August 2014 JNB-Windhoek. BA 6274 15 August 2014 Windhoek-JNB. We recently flew Comair franchise flights between Johannesburg and Windhoek the livery was BA excellent service clean and comfortable 737 on schedule hot meal served with choice of wines.

JNB to PLZ. Very good service on this lunch-time flight. Stewardess handled the issue of removing an under-age passenger from the exit row behind us with perfect tact. Tasty hot meal served efficiently (in contrast to SAA which is just a sandwich) and very fast baggage delivery.

My husband is blind and we therefore request special assistance on all flights. Flying from Durban to Johannesburg March 26th 2014 and checking in early we were allocated seats in row 21. I asked for seats nearer the front of the aircraft but was told that assisted passengers are always seated near the rear. The 3 assisted passengers on our flight were not embarked until about 20 minutes before departure and once onboard had to struggle through a nearly full aircraft to their seats. The stewardess on duty in that area was as unhelpful as she could be. We fly long haul regularly. BA always embarks assisted passengers first allowing them space to settle down before the crowd arrives. The stewardess in our cabin on our later flight to LHR couldn't have been more helpful. Why does Comair make life even more difficult for the disadvantaged?

Another trip from Johannesburg to Harare- 737s both ways and all on time. Crew were good kept us informed particularly on return flight when there were very strong winds and mine dump dust at Jo'burg. Outward meal was a hot meal return meal was the whole grain roll-this seems to be standard. No complaints at all and plenty of leg room in these old planes.

Johannesburg to Harare return. Outward flight on time - rather old 737-but clean. Cabin crew efficient lunch time flight so we were offered chicken or alternative lunch which was acceptable. Return flight left Harare on time 737 again and a light snack with drinks. Again cabin crew efficient and information from the flight deck along the route. Arrived on time-good experience overall.

DUR-CPT BA6310 2 April. As late morning flight arriving lunchtime I expected a bit of a meal. What I was offered was either a chicken roll or salad roll. I chose the salad roll - multi-grain smothered in margarine with 2 slices of cucumber! That's it! That's Comair's "salad" roll? Even QF do better on their bad domestic days! Why did SAA give up on that route?

Economy class JNB-CPT and CPT-JNB. Take off and landing in time. Baggage arrived to carousel even before passengers. Inflight staff very friendly and helpful. Meals are good also for 2 hr flight only (we had a complete lunch/dinner warm meal).

Flew PLZ-JNB as part of a BA ticket to LHR. Simply put check in was a nightmare. A bag of 25kg that had travelled with us from LHR at the same weight was rejected as overweight even though the original baggage tag (with weight clearly marked) was still attached. We spent 30 minutes at Club check in unpacking and re- packing our bags on the dirty airport floor with all our possessions spread out. Highly embarrassing until I turned around to see someone at every other counter doing the same. The manager explained that as a franchise of BA - a fact not made clear during booking nor even at the airport - BA insisted they adhere to strict baggage limits for international flights even when they could see that we were executive Gold and Bronze and had flown over with bags the same weight. For this I blame BA but the local staff could have tried to appear less pedantic and could also have found someone with a far more pleasant demeanour for the Club desk. I booked with BA for the service but on this leg was sorely disappointed.

Recently flew British Airways from Johannesburg to Cape Town. Found the plane to be very dirty and the service mediocre. Most disappointing was when the flight attendant handed me an envelope with a generic note stating that the special child meal I had requested was unavailable.
JNB-PLZ-JNB. Offers consistently good service on this route. Pleasant and attentive cabin crew decent food for a shortish commuter flight and an excellent lounge in JNB for BA Exec card members.

Windhoek-Johannesburg on a Boeing 737-300 with British Airways flag operated by Comair. Very good service and ample legroom. Aircraft clean and departure before scheduled time. A very good flight and pleasant experience.

I fly to and from NYC each week. I was doing PIT-LGA legs but the cost of the PIT-EWR flights (Continental Express operated by Comair) were significantly cheaper over the past few months. I now understand why. The 6:00PM Thurs evening flights have been cancelled for the past 4 of 5 weeks (with the 5th being delayed 2 hrs). I understand how weather and ATC can affect things but seems to be an operational issue. 4 cancellations in 5 weeks is unacceptable. I will obviously go back to the LGA-PIT legs on US Air.

Johannesburg - Port Elizabeth - Johannesburg. Outbound Friendly check-in. Superb SLOW lounge at JNB with excellent buffet breakfast. No priority boarding. Rather old 737-300 with tatty interior. Economy-type seating. FAs attentive. Breakfast served at 11.45 am and rejected after two previous breakfasts (one on Virgin flight the other in lounge). Plane seemed to have a pressurisation problem so a rather painful descent. Inbound Speedy check-in and through passport control in 5 minutes. Reasonable Premiere lounge. Old 737-400 with ashtray in toilet. Attentive FAs and better than usual lunch. Baggage handling quick. Overall good flights and better than Club Europe.

Cape Town-Johannesburg. The service was extremely attentive and catering outstanding. The cabin and seating of BA Comair aircraft mean they fall short of the likes of SAA. B737-300 was worn inside - rather dingy and dirty looking and the Business Class cabin was the same as the economy cabin save empty B and E seats. This resulted in a rather uncomfortable journey. I don't think I'll choose another Comair flight in Business Class until their fleet is renewed and material product offering improved.

Mumbai to Newark on Business first. Worst service with FA's full of attitude. Mid flight snacks very poor and just kept in the galley. No service as I saw most of the passengers to go up to the galley asking for water and tea. It was like a self service. Not a service you expect in business class.
Johannesburg to Cape Town on an early departure (0605). The seats are comfortable and Breakfast was tasty. The crew were professional and friendly. Arrived on time and no problems experienced.

Flew from Manchester UK to Newark USA with continental (now owned by United). Staff seemed a bit miserable but they did their job well and were very attentive. The inflight entertainment system was excellent and full of entertainment and the meals were what you would expect from economy class. All the flights were on time and went without any issues. overall I am happy with my experience on Continental Airlines.

Travelled from Glasgow to Newark return. Excellent service both ways with good food and ample drinks provided. Paid extra for extra legroom so seated in emergency doors. A good choice. Lots of room. The return flight had very courteous and helpful staff. They displayed lots of humour and are an asset to the company. Inflight entertainment was excellent easy to use and free. Will definitely fly with them again.

My partner had booked 4 flights to USA and within the US over 3 weeks. We flew from Heathrow to Washington to Las Vegas to Newark to Heathrow. Overall we were happy with the service provided. Checking in was quick and easy no long queues and staff helpful. Flights were on time and their system of grading boarders was good. Leg room was ample on 3 of 4 flights. We had onboard entertainment with latest films not charged extra and no technical hitches. Food given on 2 of the flights only - usual standard airline food - hot and edible. Downside was that onboard staff were unfriendly and only did the bare minimum. Some of the planes were dated. I would use this airline again but feel they need to address their cabin crews attitude as they are at the forefront of this business and people like to be greeted by friendly faces.

Travelled 4 legs inside and to/from US with Continental. As a family of 5 with 3 children we never got our reserved seats we where put in 5 different locations on the plane on all 4 legs. When we asked to sit with our children we were met with rude personnel. Booking tickets several months in advance and checking in many hours in advance made no difference. When a delay from US to Europe made us miss the connecting flight no one would help us.

TXL-EWR-CLE-EWR-TXL. Had to board a full flight manually as systems had crashed I missed the connection in EWR. Onboard attentive FA's nice food and IFE. In EWR they only managed to get me an Economy seat despite the First/Business tickets only to find at the gate they were happily upgrading frequent flyers. On return flight on one seat the IFE was broken the next the lap table didn't work so I ended up in the first row "happily" being kept awake by chatting FA's. Food was good they just forgot to get me dessert. Luggage arrived late and of course all the priority bags came in almost last. Both flights no flat beds just ones where you slide down.

Economy BFS-EWR-PTY return. BFS-EWR on 757-200 - did not bother with seatback entertainment. Crew pleasant food average but plenty of drinks rounds. Was travelling with my wife but we had been unable to get seats together. EWR-PTY - rep at gate sorted out two together. Flight to PTY (737-900) was unremarkable - the entertainment you pay for by swiping your CC. Return flight PTY-EWR: Cabin crew seemed uptight answering questions in a very unhelpful way. Request for 'trash' was like a command. EWR- BFS was marred by fact that my seat would not recline - however flight was just under 6 hours and middle seat was unoccupied. Overall a poor service with the only benefit that it was the easiest way to get to PTY from BFS.

LHR-EWR-MCO-IAD-LHR on 757/737s. Very pleased with attentive staff who were only too happy to help with any questions. Full flights all round with good food for economy. Better than BA or Virgin on similar routes staff are certainly more attentive and put customer service first. I have to say that CO/UA certainly are very reasonable for times and service of flights.

I am a disabled veteran and require a wheelchair. I don't think I have ever been ignored by anyone to this extent. I arrived in Edmonton was left sitting outside the aircraft until all passengers and crew were out. I finally wheeled myself up the three levels of ramps to customs. There was no personnel available to help me or my wife. This was on top of missing my connection on the way down.

Miami to Cleveland continuing to Syracuse NY. Plane was 15 minutes from SYR and returned to Cleveland. Eventual cancellation of SYR flight full plane. Sent to customer service line for 4 hour wait told no flights to Syracuse for 5 days. Would give us 1 night of hotel then we were on our own. Ended up having to spend $320 on car rental to drive to Syracuse. I was travelling with disabled husband and young daughter. Customer service (if you can call it that) was rude and nasty. I'm still trying to wrap my head around how I paid to fly then how it cost me an extra $320 to get home with a 7 hour drive. More than half the customers gave up on customer service line and left went directly to car rental.

My partner and I flew 4 flights in 1 week: London Heathrow-Houston-New Orleans and New Orleans-Newark- London Heathrow. 3 of the 4 flights were practically empty so legroom was made larger due to the extra seat. The entertainment on was good but we were asked to pay for the use of the TV on the flight to Newark with seemed a little bizarre. Overall the flights and food were great but awful staff attitude let them down. We didn't get one smile or pleasant exchange from the cabin crew on any of the flights. It doesn't cost anything to give someone a smile.

Managua Nicaragua to Houston. No leg room between seats. All exit aisle seats were empty as the airline now charges extra for them. Prohibited from moving to one. The video screens are right in front of your nose and are accidentally activated by resting your arm on the armrest. FA's are forced to hawk overpriced merchandise during the flight. There must be a more comfortable way to fly.

Flew round-trip LAX-Newark in the Business First section. Legroom was so small that when the seat in front of me was reclined fully I could not get out of my seat without holding on to his. The food was good but the experience certainly not worth the extra price over Economy. Continental messed up our reservations so we had to spend an hour with the airport agent to finally get 2 business seats not next to each other. Luckily other passengers were willing to switch so my husband and I could sit together.

Roundtrip Richmond to Vail Co. Reg jet from RIC to EWR was great. Excellent inflight service. EWR was awful. Gate agent was yelling at customers during boarding process. All EGE employees were great. They helped minimize the cost of luggage and assisted with every aspect of the process. Sat in first class on DIA to EWR leg and cabin crew could not have been more indifferent to the service. It was as if we were bothering them. On return flight skis were lost and did not arrive RIC. Overall very poor experience.

LHR-IAH-MSY. LHR-IAH brand new 777-200ER on time only half full had complete row to myself. Cabin staff friendly and attentive and when my ICE froze it was re-booted within minutes. Very easy journey. Food was bland and uninteresting. IAH-MSY busy flight on time with good service. Got the feeling that there is some rivalry between the United and Continental crews with the Continental folk wanting to do a bit more.

BOS-EWR-MSN. B737-700. Mid-morning flight Monday so mostly business flyers. Half-empty. 2 for every 3 seats closer to front. Full row to myself at the back. Decent sized seatback IFE. Flipped through the channels during the free preview and they have a good selection however $5.99 for 2hr or less or $7.99 2hr or more is steep. Landed Term C at EWR but need to hop on bus shuttle to Term A for regionals. Term A is awful; one way overpriced sit-down sandwich place coffee Jamba Juice and newsagent. EWR-MSN on ERJ-145 regional provider. Little overhead even with rollerboards ramp-checked.

BusinessFirst from Paris-Newark on a 757. The Star Alliance Lounge at CDG was nice enough. I feel the 757 is a small plane for that route. The Flat bed seating was nice but is was a little short for me since I am 6'3. Their AVOD is excellent and they had a great choice of movies. The food was very good and the flight attendants professional and attentive. The flight got in 30 minutes early. As a Star Alliance Gold Member I would choose United/Continental over Lufthansa because Lufthansa does not have flat bed Business Class Seating. For a US airline I feel Continental has a really good product and I hope that expands into the New United.

DFW-IAH-LHR return. Decent flight on small jet (operated by Colgan Air) to IAH. Got to board early with the United credit card which was great. IAH-LHR was on a new B-777 still in Continental livery. Clean and comfortable and no one next to me so I got two seats for the price of one! LHR-IAH was on a United B-777 and it was just as good. Only complaint was a lot of young children but another empty seat next to me. Food was pretty abysmal on the way back but it's a legacy American carrier so sort of expected. Basically 1.5 meals total each way. Overall what I expected for the price that I paid.

Flew my family of five to Nigeria - Houston-Lagos. Flight attendant was very rude food was terrible. My 9 year old vomited onboard I turned the call light 3 times to get some assistance attendant repeatedly turn it off from her rest area. When she finally decided to make rounds I asked her why no one came she rudely replied " I reset it because many people were calling". After learning my son vomited she said she would come to us last which she did 1 hour later. On our flight from Lagos to Houston my son got up to go to restroom the male attendant serving water/juice blocking the aisle told my son he has to finish serving the passengers before my son could go. I will reconsider flying Continental in the near future.

LHR-EWR in 777 economy. Was pleasantly surprised by the whole experience as was expecting something a lot worse! Plane spotlessly clean and well maintained. Relatively low load so had 3 seats between 2 of us so a bit of extra room. Service was reasonable; crew performed what they had to do but not a lot more. Food ok and drinks priced as you would expect for alcohol. Inbound was pretty much the same; very low load so had whole row to myself. IFE was good. Food was good. Crew again performed what they had to do but American based crew really don't want to go out of their way unless they have to. Overall I was pleased with the flights and would consider them again for a trip to the US.

EWR to AMS in economy on B757. Value for money was good and on the flight from AMS the cabin crew was nice and polite. On this flight the cabin crew was less friendly and polite. My kids didn't get drinks and they forgot to give me part of the meal. Furthermore they let us wait onboard at the ramp in order to get in to AMS after 07.00 hours. The flight was already 20 minutes delayed. I am not happy with this type of aircraft on a long flight. We made the same trip in 09 and flew the B676 and also A330. That was much better. For the next flight I will certainly not use the B757. Perhaps United will change this.

Flight from Buffalo to Ft Lauderdale return was a complete nightmare. Tickets that had been ordered months ahead weren't on the system so it took an hour to check-in at Buffalo. Due to late takeoff we almost missed our connection in Newark. On the way back same story about overbooked flight only seats for 3 out of our party of 4. High stress for hours until the last minute when they found the 4th seat. Delay in Newark to Buffalo almost 7 hours with no explanation. Will never fly again on that airline.

Portland-Houston-Tegucigalpa returning two weeks later. Plane cabins were ragged FA's were rude on the flight to Tegucigalpa better on the way back. Refused to hold plane less than ten minutes so a group could clear security. (TSA and customs were the real culprits though). Food? That wasn't food!

ORD-FLL-ORD. I hold United's Premium Economy so when I made the reservation I was automatically given a seat choice in the front row of the economy section where the seats have extra leg room due to the bulkhead. On the down side there was no free audio. Instead there was Direct TV which included audio but for that I would have had to pay $7.99 for the three-hour trip.

My recent First class flight from EWR to SAT was an economy flight with wide seats. The food is bad cafeteria quality at best. The flight was delayed for equipment problems after we boarded. When we asked for a bag of nuts we were warned that we were using up our one bag quota per flight. Our return flight was delayed for 4 hours due to weather. We proceeded to enter the United Club and was told that it was only available to club members or international first class only As domestic first class travelers we could buy a one day pass for $50.00 per person. I guess it wasn't enough that we paid for a full fare first class ticket. Overall a very poor experience.

Flew Belfast to New York. Husbands seat wouldn't stay in upright position on return leg and male flight attendant wouldn't listen to him - kept telling him off for reclining his seat. FA rude during food service very abrupt and openly complained to her colleague when an elderly passenger didn't hear her abrupt offer of a drink. Also husband had to check-in his hand luggage as they ran out of room in the overhead lockers (mine had to go under my seat) because they don't stop people taking on multiple bags. Would have no complaints if flight attendants were less rude.

EWR-HNL. Flight delayed by 1 hr and 25 mins on departure due to late arrival of the aircraft from HNL and then a maintenance issue. Communication from both ground grew and captain was frequent. This flight was operated with a Micronesia division plane one of four in the fleet with the smaller BusinessFirst cabin. The 767-400 is a great airplane. Feels large and airy. This plane was in good shape. Cabin crew were pleasant efficient and helpful. Mostly an older crew as this is a senior route within the system. Sat in 10K. Great legroom but the reviews are true. It does get cold in the forward Economy cabin. Food for purchase only. Will be interesting to see if HA will steal some traffic from CO on this route when they start the JFK run in June 2012. Overall a good flight but pre-merger CO's on board product is looking dated and unspectacular.

GVA-EWR-BOS and BOS-EWR-GVA a week later. Old aircraft's old-fashioned entertainment (5 channels available only in two languages). Disgusting food. You have to pay for alcohol when all other non-American major airlines provide it for free. Lazy and unfriendly crew not willing to help at any time. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone I travel four times a year to the US and as far as I am concerned it's the last time with Continental.

Cozumel to Houston - uneventful. Houston to Seattle - terrible. The temperature in the cabin was at least 90 degrees they did not announce any failure of the air conditioning it came on a few minutes prior to landing and cooled the plane slightly. Came through twice with beverage cart on a 4 hour flight. When leaving the plane I complained to a flight assistant that the temperature was too hot she responded with "oh I know". Baggage claim was announced to go to Carousel 14 and was eventually delivered to #9. Our bags were found standing in the middle of the floor on Carousel 9 and our 6th bag found on carousel 8.

San Diego to Houston. Overall I found both flight crews to be professional. Pilots took time to describe trip/weather conditions and flight attendants were nice. On the return leg of the trip there was a medical emergency on board and the crew handled it well. Check-in and boarding were easy. Seating was comfortable. Paying for checked baggage was a check against them but this is minor IMHO.

I will not use this service again. Cabin seats felt like they were broken on the 3 planes I flew on seats creaked and wobbled. Food was average as was the service. Had to reschedule my return flight due to family emergency. Instead of changing/adjusting the flight and cost I had to purchase a new ticket costing me another $1000 to return. I contacted customer service and have been ignored. In Houston the gates were changed but not updated on the boards had to sprint a half mile to catch my plane (E gates to C gates). Flying is bad enough I almost expect cattle prods the next time I fly.

SAN-IAH-LHR AMS-IAH-SAN return. Domestic segments on B737-900 transatlantic segments on B777-200ER to LHR and B767-400ER from AMS. Planes clean food above average service friendly and professional flights on time and my baggage arrived with me. Enjoyed DirectTV on domestic flights and audio-video on demand on international portions. Lie-flat seat in BusinessFirst very nice.

EWR-PBI return both on the 757. Everything went smoothly at EWR and Terminal C is the best terminal at the airport. The 757 had the New United Economy Plus seats with PTV's that has AVOD. Being 6'4 the Economy Plus seat was comfortable and is up there with Jet Blue's seat ( A very positive feature to the United merger). The AVOD was great with a long list of movies and I prefer it to the Direct TV option. The Crew on both legs were professional and attentive. I will fly Continental more often.

LHR-IAH-LAX. The only real redeeming feature was the price. Inflight service was everything I expected. One flight attendant brushed off my attempt to hand him a used cup while his colleague nonchalantly kicked my bag into position beneath the seat in front of me for landing. That bag only there because there was no space left in the overhead bins - the result of lax enforcement of cabin bag size rules. Meals were half- decent even if presentation ought to be improved. Entertainment was almost monolingual and the range of audio programmes narrow. Most crucially late departure from LHR meant I missed my connection. The same thing happened with my United IAD-FRA-LHR trip in August. As the wording on the coffee cups suggests "different name same values". I've probably learnt my lesson and will stick to European airlines for my next journey.

LHR to IAH an enjoyable experience and I'll use again. Seat was comfortable but I made a mistake of giving up my aisle seat so a couple could sit together and found it hard to get past my neighbour from the window seat. Food and IFE were good with a choice of films and a system that was easy to use. Attendants were professional. Not quite the same for the onward internal CO connection (2 hours). Tired seats and cold meal only.

AMS-LAD-BOS. Smooth check-in at the airport because the flight was not fully booked they changed seats for us so we had the middle seat free. We flew the good old 757 seat was ok. Food nowadays on those intercontinental flights is below average. Crew were friendly and attentive. IE system average with enough movies to watch. We arrived 20 minutes early. On the leg to BOS everything went smoothly. We arrived a couple of minutes early and for the money paid I would do it again.

PDX-ATL round trip. Very uncomfortable seats poor food offered flight attendants acted like they were doing passengers a favor. Had to wait forever to use to toilet. Since Continental merged with United they have sunk to an all time low. In the past they allowed upgrades for a reasonable fee - not anymore! They let premium seats go empty even when the plane was on its last segment and airborne the flight attendants would not let anyone sit in an area with more leg room. They said it was "reserved". I simply refused to upgrade to first class for $619 and they had empty seats there also. In the past before they merged with United I could upgrade for around $100 if seats were available. I simply don't understand the cost/benefit ratio of letting seats go empty instead of making them affordable or allowing someone to use coach class seats with more leg room once the aircraft is in flight. My ticket wasn't cheap to start with and the service I got was terrible from start to finish. This merger was not for the better!

Minneapolis-Chicago-Houston-Bogota. The booking appeared as United but in reality the flights Chicago- Houston-Bogota are Continental. When in Bogota I called the Continental line to check about possibility of return date change. The Customer Service rep said my flights were book through United so I would have to contact them for any changes. The problem is they do not operate in Colombia so did not know how to contact them. Aircraft's covering this route are uncomfortable 737-800 for a 4.5 hr international flight the return flight did not have TV or music options. I was used to AA broad body aircraft's for international travel which are more appropriate. I guess for the fare paid I could not ask much but I would not repeat the trip.

Flew non-stop from San Francisco to Newark NJ. My complaint concerns insufficient overhead luggage space. As you know the passengers board from the back of the plane. I was in aisle #23 about mid-way on the plane. Yet by the time I boarded all the overhead space was taken. This is due to the incompetence of airline personnel who routinely allow people to take luggage on the plane that clearly exceeds the size limits. I flagged down a flight attendant and insisted that she find room for my luggage. Of course the airline is ultimately to blame for charging people to check luggage the first piece should be free.

Dulles to Houston and the crew did a great job. Regional jets are not comfortable for flying half way across the country there is very little room for carry on luggage mine had to go in the cargo area. For the prices we pay for flights the airline needs to at least provide a sandwich for an early morning trip. I have flown many times in the past and am getting to the point that I would rather drive.

Heathrow to Newark. Check-in was impersonal and the few people that were available to help when my passport would not scan were ill informed and were unable to answer questions. Outbound flight was acceptable although food was cold. Our return flight which was a night flight was atrocious! As we had not reserved seats on our outbound flight we were advised to reserve them 24 hours prior to departure for our flight home. We duly did this and foolishly moved seats from those that had been allocated for us. The seats that we booked were in row 14 and we were unaware until we boarded the plane that these were non- reclining seats. Had the online booking system made this clear we would never have booked these seats. My husband is 6'2" and had to attempt to be comfortable in his seat with the seat in front reclined on top of him and his TV screen about 10" from his face. Flight attendants were extremely apologetic and said that we could move seats but that we would have to sit separately. Once again my food was cold and this time inedible. We also struggled to put our 'carry-on' luggage into the overhead storage as many people had stowed suitcases. Whilst we cannot fault the flight attendants for their service my husband was knocked by one or the other of the ladies each time they came past him. Overall our experience of Continental Airlines was very poor and we will not use them again. It is all very well to provide cheap flights but value for money should also imply customer satisfaction.

EWR to BOM return. The flight attendants seemed rude and apathetic to passengers' needs. Instead of trying to make the 15 hr flight tolerable they tended to add to the stress level of passengers. In fact soon after boarding I remember the flight attendants screaming at passengers to sit down. They seemed annoyed when requested for even minor help like requesting an extra blanket and looked at you with disdain if you dared to ask whether they carried a certain newspaper.

We just completed a so-called Business/First Class trip to and from India and the only thing "first class" about it were the new bed seats. For the most part flight attendants seem 'tired' of their jobs - when I asked to be shown how to use the lighting the stewardess replied that she was not familiar enough with it to be of help. In previous years food service was exceptional this time there was no liquor cart and you had to ask for a drink. Breakfast was thrown at us in the last 45 mins of the trip. The overall quality of the food was very poor overcooked and not very well presented. Continental used to do a lot better. Hopefully their merger with United will help put them back on track.

LHR-EWR-PHX Business 1st. Check-in at LHR T4 was ok at best. Not a huge line but not tightly run. Will say they were informative about lounge and gate area. Same person that checked me in came on the plane to address each 1st pax. Seats comfortable and well appointed. IFE was good managed to keep my attention but not the most up to date. Food was very good. Have to say service was spotty depending on who was serving. FA forgot drinks / what was ordered throughout flight but noticed the FA for the other aisle was spot on. Appetizer cart then main. Followed by ice cream dessert. EWR-PHX leg in 1st - again comfortable. Direct TV was nice to have but nothing to watch! Have to say again meal was very good. Having transited to Europe on another carrier CO will be merging with hope the level of service and quality skews to CO as they offered a better product.

We upgraded to First Class and had to fight for everything we wanted. The flight attendant started by offering us either water or orange juice. The food offered was the same as the food in Economy and when asked for more they told us one package per person and no washroom for just First Class. The First Class flight attendant assigned to take care of 6 people helped more with Economy class and even ignored our repeated calls for service. We finally arrived at Toronto International Airport in a rain storm and were told to get off the plane and walk. We will never fly Continental or United Airlines again.

SDQ-EWR. The arrogance of the Continental crew is only surpassed by their lack of competence. No individual entertainment system despite this being a 4 hr flight and the choice of movie was inappropriate for children. The food was awful.

MCO-EWR-LHR. Very poor service and I've flown with many airlines over the past 7 years. 757-200 MCO-EWR was just about acceptable however the overnight service from EWR-LHR was dreadful. No priority boarding for Star Alliance Gold Members or Business Class pax 7 hrs on what appeared a very old 757-200. Food was appalling and inedible FA's totally disinterested I don't expect much in economy but other airlines manage so why not CO. I wont be using them again after 7 years of Gold membership I'm very much thinking of switching my loyalty to another alliance/airline if this is the best United/Continental can offer.

London-Newark and Newark-Costa Rica. The international leg was fine. The outward trip to CR was just awful. No entertainment system unless you wanted to pay one drink and one snack no blanket or pillow. The staff just seemed to disappear. The return leg was better. More drinks and two snacks but still no free entertainment system. I would not choose to use Continental again unless I had no choice.

The food in the forward cabin from Liberia Costa Rica to Houston Texas was virtually inedible. The passengers in economy were told there was only one choice rather than several available for purchase which is inexcusable on a flight of more than 3 hours. The connecting flight to Denver already delayed for an hour without explanation from the crew. the purser and 3 other flight attendants stood talking in the forward galley without offering a glass of water or other beverage to the first class passengers for more than 30 mins. When service was given it was grudging save for one attendant. The merger despite corporate ads to the contrary have done nothing for customer service. We would choose to fly almost any other airline overseas and certainly Frontier rather than the new United domestically.

NRT-EWR flight. Perpetually uncooperative and tired crew. Not interested in smiling. Unbelievably poor quality breads. Crew not interested in coming round for a second time to serve despite being in the business cabin.

Manchester to Newark. Flight was on time and staff were friendly and provided an excellent service providing drinks throughout as well as trolley services. The return journey was a little late leaving due to problems with air traffic control but the Captain kept passengers informed about the delay. My seat pitch was sufficient but I wish airlines would deter passengers from reclining their seats when there is limited space available especially when tables are down for eating/drinking.

SEA-EWR-BOS-IAH-SEA. On all flights staff were indifferent or just plain rude. Seat comfort nice until I boarded final leg of my journey. I expected 737-900 to be modern and comfortable as 3 previous aircraft's but looking at the interior it seemed to be too old for 737-900. Seat pitch tiny and seats narrowest I have seen. Continental has become substandard at par with US Airways. Beverages offered - cup of ice with splash of soda or juice. Only SEA-EWR had entertainment system working as for others it didn't exist or was broken. Service was just awful.

Birmingham-Newark. Excellent service. Only grumble - I had reserved seats for both ways (Row 10ABC). Fine going out coming in after automatic check in at Newark found ourselves on Row 38ABC - disappointing. Cabin Crew on both segments were on hand if needed.

LAX-IAH-EZE in Business First. LAX Presidents Club fine. Initial domestic leg was good with an older but friendly crew. Day time food good and wine OK. Attentive throughout the flight. Second segment was on a 777-300 where we weren't able to be seated together. A passenger overhearing the request kindly offered to move. The level of service continued to be poor the food and wine was also below standard. The amenity kit was good. The crew gave the impression they were just going through the motions.

TPA-IAH-PHX in coach. Exit row seat TPA-IAH regular coach seat IAH-PHX. Big difference in room and comfort! Full planes on both segments but even with all that carry on both flights on time. Still amazes me how everyone crams near the gate at the beginning of boarding and are turned away due to them trying to board early. Kudos to the gate agents for controlling that. Power source nice to have to stay charged. Direct TV available if you are willing to pay if not you are on your own.

On a recent flight DEN-LAS we were charged $75.00 each as we flew on a flight standby earlier than our scheduled fight. Three other people we knew travelling the same flight also earlier (Standby) were not charged the $75 fee. We currently (my wife and I) have over 60000 miles with Continental although we are not Elite status. None of the three other people we knew on the flight were "Elite" status either although they were not charged? I've written a formal complaint to Continental Airlines and have not heard back from them it's been two weeks now since the written complaint.

While traveling to Orlando from Belfast my family (my husband and 2 sons who were 3yrs 9 months and myself) stopped over in Newark. The flight was late and we had a short connection. We would not have made it if it had not been for our angel a Continental Employee who helped us out so much. She was amazing and because of her we not only made the flight but had time to spare. I can not thank her enough. Traveling with small kids was nightmare and she made our experience in the airport a dream. 6 months later and we still appreciate the wonderful help.

Newark to London Heathrow. Overhead lockers jammed packed full with oversize luggage which none of the ground or flight attendants seemed to pay any attention to albeit that their was a luggage guide frame at the boarding desk. This in turn led to chaotic passenger boarding! Surely there is a limit to the size and amount of cabin stored luggage? Footway aisles in the rows were grossly overloaded with excess baggage. Surely a safety issue let alone an inconvenience to passengers who are prepared to have luggage put in the hold.

NY to Cleveland for business. The experience was good and I felt comfortable - I bought extra leg room for a small amount of money. I wouldn't say that it's necessarily worth it for the short flights but I can see how it can make a difference in longer flights. I also found out that I can add the miles to my miles & more account.

LFT-IAH-EWR-PWM. CO Express ERJ 145 regional LFT-IAH with nice onboard service. We used the Presidents Club at IAH and wonderful service at the bar. B767-400ER IAH-EWR were told champagne was no longer available on domestic first class flights. Excellent cabin service with a nice lunch. BusinessFirst sleeper seats were comfortable on this relatively short domestic leg. Used the Presidents Club at EWR and it was fine. CO Connection Dash 8-Q400 EWR to PWM although this was a new aircraft there is no escaping the fact that a turboprop is slower with a much noisier cabin than a regional jet. On board service was lackluster. Bags although priority tagged took a long time to arrive at the baggage claim.

Birmingham to Newark and onto Cincinnati return. I felt I got good value. Flights were on time slightly delayed but only due to air traffic control. I paid for the extra leg room seats as I am tall. The inflight entertainment was good own screen with a library of films and programs/music to choose from. Flight attendants from BHX to EWR were nice and the only 'not so nice' one was on my return from Cincinnati but it hardly ruined my experience. Only issue was the food - I ordered an Asian Vegetarian meal and got curry (both ways) fine but not at 11 am. And as my 'snack' I got a carrot roll. Awful. Eat before you go.

LAX-IAH-BOG outbound in First/Business PTY-IAH-LAX return in Economy. Redeye to Bogota. LAX-IAH flight was cancelled was proactively booked on an earlier flight to make my connection to Bogota and was grateful for the forward thinking. Food limited in the Presidents Club - just cheese and crackers but good wine and they kept the shower open for me for my midnight departure. IAH-BOG flight attendants extremely rude. Seemed hurried and unable to cope. Food ok and the 737 Y seats had limited recline. Return flight PTY-IAH comfortable in coach. IAH-LAX you could tell that it was an EWR crew as they were ruder and less polished. Uncomfortable flight but all in all a good experience.

MIA-EWR 737-700 (Business) upgrade. CO terminal at MIA outdated compared to AA's. Ground personnel were sufficiently attentive to direct you to where you needed to go. Aircraft needed some cleaning and sitting at the bulkhead was painful given the limited legroom. Business Class breakfast and frequent refreshments were welcomed. Glad to fly them again next week to Mexico on their 777-200 between Newark and Houston.

I was returning from Frankfurt. The flight was late arriving and I missed my connection to Los Angles. At this point I did not know what to do I went to the Continental desk and explained my dilemma. The counter attendant and her supervisor treated me with disdain and I was embarrassed by their behaviour. Needless to say I was given a hotel room and left the next day. I will be very hesitant to fly Continental again.

We chose Continental for our flight to Hong Kong because it was cheap. Arrived at the airport 2.5 hrs early we were told our chosen flight was late and we would miss our connecting flight if we were to take it. We ended up sprinting across the airport to make a different flight and barely made it. An hour into our connecting flight after our layover we were told there were technical problems so they had to turn back the plane. On arrival back to the US we sat onboard for 5-6 hrs. They only explained to us how long it would take and we were only given a bag of peanuts and a drink. I begged an attendant for an extra bag of peanuts and eventually she gave it to me.

Newark to Seattle. The plane was full however I could not believe how little room the seat provided in Economy Class. I am 5 ft 10 190 lbs and I felt extremely uncomfortable. On my return flight I took United which operated an Airbus rather than the 737. I also opted to spend $69 for more leg room but I did feel the width of the seat was wider than the Continental flight. I understand the two airlines are merging and I hope United does not 'shrink' the seats as a result. The whole experience from paying for the one piece of luggage I had to paying for a meal if I desired makes me long for the 'good old days'.

IAH-BWI. B737-900. Inflight entertainment was good. They have Direct TV installed and stream live programs. Its costly though. Food and drinks were pretty much standard. Flight took off and landed on time.

Pittsburgh to Chicago. Overall the flight was nice the aircraft clean and the staff friendly. I really like the Direct TV added to the seats however the price was ridiculous to say the least. $5.99 for flights 2 hrs or less and $7.99 for longer flights. IMHO regular commercial TV should be free and $5.99/$7.99 should be for premium commercial free content like movies HBO Showtime and Sports. I didn't see anyone using it past the free preview on the entire flight once the blue pop-up came up I opened my laptop and watched a DVD. Another thing that gets me is the Boarding. There is no advantage to preferred boarding anymore everyone is some kind of club member airline branded credit card holder or something special that gets to board early. If you are flying with infants the overheads are filled before you get on the aircraft and it is a pain to have herd your family over a bunch of pre- boarders giving you dirty looks as you try to carry a baby and 4 bags and manage a child as you inch down the plane. I thought that I had preferred boarding on my last flight and two groups in addition to the military disabled and first-class boarding before me.

Edinburgh to Newark return to Edinburgh. Both flights left early and arrived an hour before scheduled landing. Legroom room better than any charter flight and no worse than a budget airline which Continental is. Food was what it is you can't expect 5 star cuisine. Cabin crew friendly and worked hard. I read so many negative reviews I was dreading the flight but it was great. I'm just glad I can fly direct from Edinburgh to New York and don't have to go to London to change and 7 hr flight time isn't that long. I feel I got what I paid for.

I am a frequent flyer with Elite status. I loved Continental service in the past but since the merger with United the flying experience has become at times miserable. United has pretty awful customer service. They do not communicate at the gate leaving passengers wondering what is going on when things are running late which is often. Then when they load the plane it is absolute chaos. Twice in the last month I've been on a flight to Chicago and no announcement at all was made to board. They simply opened the door and people started pushing toward it. I prefer not to pay over $500 per ticket to be treated this way. Lack of communication. I recently flew US Air and was pleasantly surprised.

Edinburgh to Newark. Newark to Orlando. The only good things about this flight was the legroom and punctuality of all flight sectors even with storms in New York we were not delayed. Food was awful and not enough for a long haul flight with only a croissant for breakfast. Your own TV did not have a great choice of movies. I would class Continental as a budget airline and not a great one at that. Improve food and movie choice and they would be better. Do not choose row 14 in their 757s or 737s seats don't recline.

Newark-Dublin tickets booked 7 months ahead only to be assigned the last 2 seats in the last row of the plane - row 40 E/F. Having to sit with a queue of passengers waiting for the toilet standing in our faces for over 4 hrs of a 6 hr flight. This was intrusive uncomfortable and most upsetting for us. Furthermore we were unable to recline our seats for a bit of comfort seeing that our seats were right up against the bulkhead furthermore a tall passenger sitting in front of my husband's seat had reclined her seat to the maximum with her long legs sticking up over the seat in front. We felt trapped and I was unable to get out of my seat to use the toilet or stretch my back during the whole 6 hr flight. Obviously if we could afford to fly Business class we would but seeing that we can't all it would have taken was a little kindly observant thoughtfulness and consideration.

Newark to Heathrow. The flight was scheduled for 9.10 pm but was delayed. We finally took off at 10 pm. Very small cramped plane the staff whilst not rude were tired looking and not helpful. I will not fly Continental again. The planes are small little leg room and the staff not as professional as those with other carriers.

Sadly I was caught up in Hurricane Irene I was stuck in the US for an extra 6 days with no clear sign of when I would get home as CA phone lines were jammed and when I did get in the on-hold queue I was disconnected after 2 hrs. This happened 5/6 times. I held for a total of 22.5 hours before speaking to someone 4 days after my original flight home had been cancelled. The flight home via Newark was on a small almost domestic sized planes which allowed no real room for comfort or sleep. Other passengers taller than myself didn't cope quite as well. Overall not a good experience for me due to poor CA updates and the lack of being able to talk to someone. However I will say that the CA advisor I did eventually speak with was apologetic sympathetic and a good ambassador for CA.

Arrived at the airport 3 hrs ahead of time only to be faced with long line up because several agents were dealing with people who came to the airport late. 40 mins prior to our flight we were pulled out of line requesting that we immediately check-in. We did this only to be told that no seats were assigned so onboard we asked the attendant if our family could be seated together. The attendants response was that we catch the next flight out. Her tone of voice and response was out of line and rude.

Birmingham-Cancun via Newark. Seat space tight and I am only 5'3". Food was poor I had the vegetarian option which wasn't so appealing. Inflight entertainment ok on Birmingham-Newark leg however headphones had to be purchased for Newark to Cancun leg of the journey. On the return trip flight was cancelled due to snow this in itself wasn't the issue but the attitude of the staff made this minor issue an awful experience. I was diverted via Houston with a short connection time this flight was delayed resulting in me missing my connection. Inflight cabin crew had no idea about flight schedules and didn't help us to disembark the plane first. Spent the night at Houston to get the flight the next day rude and dismissive staff no attempt to help or even be polite to people in a difficult position.

Staff were rude and impatient and passengers seemed to be a bother to them. The seats hardly reclined and my 5 hr trip became quite uncomfortable. While the price was right I would pay a little more for a quality flight.

Glasgow to Newark. Most flight attendants were unable to smile. Check-in on return was awful self check-in is confusing. A staff member approached as I was unsure what to do and started barking instructions at me.

I had booked my parents tickets PA to Mumbai via Newark. On arrival at the airport we were taken to one side and told our flight to Newark had been cancelled. In a rude manner we were told we had 2 options to take the train to Newark and fly from there or change the journey date. My parents age are over 65 years old plus my mother needs a wheelchair and cant walk the train was impossible with bags and check-in at Newark. Our tickets were changed however they failed to notify us. Finally after much trouble my parents boarded a flight to Mumbai from Newark.

EWR to BRU return. Seats were uncomfortable with little cushion and there was a metal box underneath the seat in front on both flights so I couldn't stretch my legs. Food was poor quality and they charged for alcoholic beverages. Crew were friendly and the individual seatback screens were nice with lots of entertainment. I would not recommend Continental for international flights.

EWR-LIM. Adequate at best. Flight departed on time but the cabin was worn out and the food was nasty. There were also brown burn stains on the outside of the tray. The only saving grace was the excellent video on demand entertainment. The food was awful though.

EWR to YYZ. Flight delayed 4.5 hrs due to bad weather. Passengers were required to wait 4.5 hrs for the arrival of a pilot. The flight took off over 9 hrs late airport staff would not give any answers to questions and seemed to be avoiding them. No compensation offered.

IAD to SFO. Despite booking seats next to each other our seats were changed and we were 10 rows apart. Other couples faced the same problem despite the bookings being on the same eticket. Our previous Continental flight was 4 hrs late with no apology from ground cabin or flight deck staff. Service was very poor.

CDG-IAD in Business First on a 757-200. The Lie-Flat Business First seat is very comfortable. Flight on time and the crew friendly and professional. The only negative were the rude Continental employees who conduct the US immigration/security checks prior to entering the check-in area.

Round the World trip from Brisbane. We boarded United Airlines (operated by Continental) from Boston to Edinburgh. We boarded late due to weather the plane had not been properly cleaned (candy wrappers used tissues in seat pocket. Charged $6 for small lite beer only to be told they did not accept cash. Food provided was the most poorly presented we have ever had. We have been Star Alliance customers for many years and have flown with most of the Alliance Airlines but without doubt this Flight was the worst.

BOS-EWR in Economy on 12.59pm out of Boston. Normally a 1 hr trip this time 6 hrs. After numerous excuses over a 70 mins period flight cancelled completely. Two incompetent gate agents trying to re-route very long line of frustrated passengers with connections out of Newark. After waiting over 1 hr for agents to process 4 passengers ahead of us and having missed the next flight to Newark we were put on the 4.30pm with assurances our luggage would follow us. Needless to say it did not make it to Newark with us on our or the next flight.

EWR-BRU in Elite First. Pleasantly surprised professional cabin crew 4 staff for the first section of the Business cabin on the new B777. Food good quality for a US carrier. Seats comfortable allowing a couple of hours of sleep. Entertainment system was very good with a selection of movies and TV series. Arrived in Brussels well ahead of schedule.

We were very worried about flying Continental I have to say they were very good. We were a party of 5 and nothing was to much trouble. Flying from Birmingham to New York the plane was clean and tidy a good selection on the entertainment system and the food was hot and filling.

I flew from Chicago-Houston at 3 am. The plane was an old and dirty 737-800 the seats were hard and staff were rude. They were advertising some TV shows they would be showing but were nowhere to be found.
Booked to fly Virgin LHR-New York codeshare meant I flew back with Continental. Excellent service comfortable 3-3-3 Boeing 777 layout. Tasty dinner and breakfast and professional crew.

Our outbound fight to Edinburgh from Newark was okay except there is very little leg-room. I could not recline my seat properly. Alcoholic drinks were not free. On the return they asked for volunteers to get bumped I volunteered. They told me to board so I did only to be told to leave the plane and collect a voucher I was just about to leave the terminal when I was told to re-board. After 2 hours the flight is cancelled. Staff rude and hostile no information provided. Given ticket on BMI to LHR. Delayed flight but at least BMI gave its passengers access to the Business Class lounge. Arrive at Newark 30 hours later than planned.

Alexandria LA to Houston TX return. Houston to Alexandria flights were very uncomfortable. The smaller aircraft Saab SF 340A/B very warm and never cooled down during the 45 min flight. The cabins exhibit a lot of wear/tear and are very dusty/dirty. Noticed some deep gashes in the overhead carry-on compartments and several areas where the pieces of steel broken from where the seats are secured. Magazine bags dirty with threads hanging from them. Returning from Houston I was assigned seat 3A but someone had already been given this seat. The attendant moved me to a seat by the door unfortunately this was awkward for myself having muscular deficits so once everyone had boarded the FA moved me.

PHL to Houston to Cancun but left PHL late since they had to replenish the oxygen. We kept being told we would arrive on time into Houston however we had lost our take-off slot. In Houston the doors opened 15 mins before the Cancun flight was supposed to take off. Being at the back of the plane it took some time to get out Ran through the airport to be told our seats had been given to standby passengers. We were given hotel and food vouchers but then they came up with the idea to fly us to Corzumel. Were told our luggage would be on that flight but it did not arrive and has still not be traced according to their website. Continental offered money for clothes but it far from ideal.

FLL-EYW on Beechcraft operated by Gulfstream International Airlines. Aircraft was OK taking into account it's 19-seater staff could be better both on ground and on board (first officer seemed like he didn't want people on board). There is no service since it's only 50 mins long flight and there are no flight attendants. Not bad but could be better.

A direct flight from Newark to Phoenix. Arrived at the airport 5:30AM. Checked in and booked baggage day before. All we had to do at Newark Airport was give them our luggage. The Continental employee told us to go to the outside skycap for checking baggage. It was a long line. We waited so long we were locked out of our flight. No one cared. We finally got baggage put through inside (after much stress). We raced to the flight and missed it by a minute. Customer Service did book us on a later flight but did it unwillingly. Everyone at Continental was rude. We missed a whole day of vacation. I will never fly Continental again.

The flight to France was delayed for 6 hrs at Newark airport. There were no satisfying explanation given to passengers. The $6 food voucher came 3 hrs later when most restaurants were about to close. We needed a wheel chair that never showed up. We were denied pillow and blankets for my elderly diabetic mother after waiting in the airport for 7 hrs. The staff left the desk unattended to avoid answering the passengers. The list goes on and on.
BRU-EWR-BRU was fairly good in-flight entertainment was nice. Plane looked new and clean legroom was sufficient food was ok although cabin crew seemed to be a little indifferent.

San Jose-Anchorage-Vancouver-San Jose. To get to ANC I had to connect on Denver that flight after being delayed for more than 4 hrs without any explanation was cancelled the Gate Attendant only told that us your flight was cancelled this is the phone number for all of you to call Reservations Dpt. When I called Reservations they offered me a flight that departed DEN 2 days after. I had to buy a new ticket with a different airline at that time only First Class was available so I paid more for that portion of the trip than I had paid for the rest of my itinerary. As I didn't use the rebooked flight they cancelled the rest of my reservation so the day that I was coming home was a total headache to get seats. Again without any notice they decided to change the aircraft and this new one didn't have the "C" seat position in Economy class therefore it departed with more than 1 hr of delay while the Gate Attendants manually found seats for the passengers that originally had seats on that position.

This was our first time and our last time flying Continental. We had planned this vacation for 4 months and was very excited until the nightmare begin with continental airlines. We left first flight on time then arrived at our connecting flight in 3 hrs instead of the 2 hrs as schedule. Missing our connecting flight due to flight being longer. Continental never tried to offer us another flight to final destination on the same day-but did say we could fly out 1 day later. We stayed in the Houston airport for 8 hrs on standby flights with 25+ others with no assistance from continental going from gate to gate with no direction . Until finally we demanded that we be confirmed on some flight or a refund. The customers service was not helpful/friendly at all. After being confirmed all our times had changed for arrival back home. Coming back they cancel our fight so we spent another 8 hrs waiting until continental put us on another airlines - we flew out of way and waited again. The fill in airlines treated us much better than Continental. We lost 1 day of our planned vacation - 1 day from work due to not be able to arrive as schedule. We were very dissatisfied with continental service. Actually we were treated better by the Continental foreign country airlines customer services than the USA customer service.

Houston-Sao Paulo-Houston. Fully loaded planes (767-300) with on time departure and arrival but extremely bad service. Flight attendants disappeared after serving dinner never to be seen again. If you want water you have to get up and get it. I pushed the flight attendant button so many times that I gave up. Breakfast: 4 pieces of fruit a soggy croissant jam and coffee that tasted like dishwashing water.

It was another miserable experience with Continental. We arrived at the Cozumel airport 2 hrs early then stood a line in the lobby for 1.5 hrs as 2 or 3 Con people checked in an airplane full of international travellers. We arrived at Bush International 5 mins late then sat on the runway for 20 mins waiting for a gate to open. We rushed to the gate only to find the times continually pushed back so that the plane ultimately took off at midnight rather than 19.30. It had been held in El Paso because the temperature was 107-the Embraer was rated to take off at 104 or less.

EWR-DUB CDG-EWR. Check in at Newark with ong lines. Dinner after take off wasn't too bad they had to reset the AVOD twice making my movie restart to the beginning. Light breakfast before landing. Trip home from CDG as good drinks and pretzels after take off then meal which was very good. Staff came around with drinks throughout flight. Landed on time and customs quick at EWR. Baggage was left in CDG due to security reason" and was sent to my house the next day. Overall service was great but the price was a little high compared to our other options.

Trip to Las Vegas from Indianapolis. Had a stop-over in Cleveland Ohio. On the trip home our flight out of Cleveland was cancelled and we were told we could not get a flight until Sunday. This was Indy 500 weekend so we figure they sold our seats for $. We were sent home by a 5hr hour bus ride. Onboard seats are small and leg room so little that even though we are both slender we were very uncomfortable. We won't choose this airline again nor will we recommend it to others.

On the flight from LA to Houston no one checked hand carry luggage. Some bags should have been checked and stored in baggage compartment - the number of hand carried items were excessive leading to no storage space overhead in your selected seats. When I asked for help staff was not interested.

Rudest staff ever encountered on an airline - staff were surly sarcastic and very unfriendly. I was ignored by one of the hostesses when I requested a newspaper from her trolley as she was in so much of a rush to get up the aisle due to the fact that they were late boarding the plane. Food tasted like the sort of food you got on planes 20 years ago - inedible pasta a limp salad and a stale bread roll does not make an appetizing meal.

The in-flight service on Lima - Newark flight was dismal. Our row was overlooked when the meal was served. When I went to ask for our meal there was no apology and I was left with the feeling that I had inconvenienced the flight attendants. When I went to queue for the lavatory I also informed the flight attendant that the mother sitting alongside us would like some milk for her child. A hand emerged from behind the curtain with a cup of milk for ME to take to the mother. I didn't mind taking the milk but it's surely part of the flight attendant's duties to see to passengers' needs. We had one and a half hours to make our connecting flight to Heathrow. We didn't make it. Why does Continental put passengers under this kind of pressure knowing that you now have to wait for your luggage  go through immigration and check in your luggage again? The booking of a later flight (9hrs later) was dealt with in a disorganized and indifferent manner. When I asked if food vouchers would be given the supervisor at first said "No" then a grudging "Give them $8". The flight attendants on the Newark - Heathrow leg were friendly and efficient. Wish there were more like them!

PHX-IAH-MSY economy. Both flights completely full and both on time. Seating tight but managed ok. Very little leg room thankfully seats have limited recline. FAs made frequent drink runs. All in all decent trip.
EWR-HKG on B-777. New airplane IFE really good. Crew polite and helpful. Food was nowhere to compare with most Asian or European carrier.

London-Houston on B777. Crew were great half full cabin. Aircraft was clean lie flat seat very comfortable food tasty. Large PTV. An added bonus was that in Houston I did not have to collect my bag for the onward flight to Panama and there was a special immigration queue for connecting passengers which meant I was back airside within 15 minutes of landing.

Manchester-Newark-Grand Rapids. Online check-in did not work. B757-200 old noisy airplane for long haul. Inefficient scruffy looking rude staff. Alcoholic drinks charged for. Horrible sub-standard meals. US immigration staff at Newark airport nice. Flight from Newark to Grand Rapids delayed due to tech fault. Only soft drinks served on 2 hour flight. Overall terrible experience.

Delayed and stranded! First we it was going to be 6pm so we arrived at SFO at 4pm to learn that flight was delayed 40 min. The second delay notice came as 7.40pm. We were exhausted after a 5 hour long drive and finally relieved when boarding started somewhere around 7pm. But then there was a problem with the pilot. We were inside what was a smelly and hot aircraft for nearly an hour until the pilot came and started the engine. Then it began to cool down but had to wait another half an hour to start the trip. Finally it was 2am when we arrived at Houston. Was a lot of waste of time for a four plus hour trip. The only good thing was the cabin crew.

Horrible experience yesterday at Newark! Our flight was moved four times to a different gate and then cancelled - no explanation. Customer service was appalling and abrasive and I was even threatened with the Port Authority Police when I demanded to know the reason for the cancellation. At the end I had to sleep at the airport after a long international trip. Please save yourself the aggravation and book your next flight with a real airline!

EWR-BOG-EWR flight used to be on a 757-200. The 5 hours flight was comfortable enough. Within years it all went down. No Business first then no B757. Now the B737-500 to 800 are cramped small and not convenient for such international flight.

I missed a flight because my first flight was delayed - they couldn't book me till the next day and didn't pay for any hotel accommodation. They had 2 representatives to take care of a line of about 40 people all who had missed flights. One of the representatives was designated to "elite members" but then the other worker began taking elite members only too. This left no one for the other 40 of us!

Extremely poor customer service for Newark-Mumbai flight. The flight was heavily overbooked and instead of helping the customers with other available options the attendants were screaming at them. Even on volunteering to go by an alternate route I was not given a boarding pass on time for the alternate flight. The attendants were rude and refused to answer my queries.

TPA-EWR-LHR. Check in a joke. Not obvious what was what. Self checkin was confusing and required help from someone who didn't look like they were employed at the airport but were still behind the desk. At the gate they had part-timers who were not very good at crowd control. Flight delayed due to bad weather in Newark and we were getting updates every 30 minutes until about 2 hours then nothing for another 2 hours until departure announcement by that point most passengers had rescheduled including me. Staff at the desk to reschedule were fantastic and had a good chat. They put me on the one the next morning which was full and had drinks but not much else. EWR-LHR was on a 757 tiny plane fully booked and every seat had a power adaptor in the footwell so uncomfortable. Only managed about 30 minutes of sleep from the collection of trays to the lights being turned back on. They also hadn't seated a young daughter with her father so required a voluntary seat change I don't see how that situation even arose?

MAN-EWR. Incredibly slow check in (took over 1 hour) - about 4 open desks 1 of which was for Business. When this early in the morning you don't want to be waiting for more than an hour in a line! Onboard all was good meals average but the aircraft was quite clean tidy and with personal AVOD system.

LHR-EWR EWR-MSY and MSY via IAD to LHR. Most flights on time. Onboard IFE was very good for a US carrier. Food not brilliant but our expectations were low in the first place. FA efficient and friendly enough.

EWR-HNL-EWR. Continental no longer gives out complimentary food on this 10 hour+ flight from Newark to Hawaii. And to make matters worse my original ticket said that meals were included but I was never contacted about the changed policy. I ended up having just a small snack before boarding and was shocked to see only food for purchase offered (which they ran out of). Pretty disgraceful for a long-haul flight!

Heathrow to Houston with Continental. Found the flight attendants rude and they appeared to be put out when you asked them a question. Although I had booked a vegetarian meal there was no vegetarian option for one of the meals - only a meat sandwich. The flight attendant did not care and I was denied a meal. On the return I asked at check in to confirm my vegetarian meal had been ordered. The reply was along the lines that if there wasn't a vegetarian meal onboard then I should make do with what there was available - eg. remove the meat from the meal. I did receive my vegetarian meal this time but it was frozen and by the time it had defrosted I discovered it wasn't worth the wait. We were left with the trays on our tables for 45mins before flight attendants came around to remove the rubbish. If at all possible the flight attendants were even more rude on the return journey and incredibly inefficient. They are by far and away the worst airline I have ever had.

Over inflated flight attendants think they have all the power in the universe one decided to eject a MM+ Platinum from the aircraft because she wanted the seat (up front near the door). Will never again fly this airline - after 15+ years of loyalty I'm done.

TPA-EWR-FRA. B737 ex TPA was 90 minutes late due to mechanics in EWR. Enough time to change in EWR however the airport was a chaos with permanent changing gates and Presidents Club being more than full and unpleasant. B777 to FRA great lie-flat seat good IFE and crew helpful & friendly. Food was ok nothing special.

Newark to Frankfurt. Poor service and poor food compared with other airlines on the same route. They charge high prices for drinks of any kind and everything is served in the same time around. Frankfurt to Newark used Lufthansa - same price but what a difference in service and quality. At Lufthansa the food was good and we were served repeatedly. And no payment for anything. No wonder the Lufthansa flight was fully booked while in the Continental flight had many empty seats.
LHR-EWR-LHR. Cabin Crew okay food except breakfast okay breakfast - 5 pieces of fruit plus croissant. Both flights on time baggage arrived operated by B757-200 with PTV screen to watch films.

LHR-IAH-GRK rtn. LHR-IAH on B777-200 and IAH-GRK Saab340 (Colgan Air). All flights on time. Airport and ground staff helpful and friendly used online check-in and very efficient bag drop at LHR Terminal 4 - took less than 5 minutes to clearing security and getting airside. Seated in 44B both flights on B777 and found seats to comfortable and good value for money. AVOD worked superbly and a huge choice. Cabin crew were OK and did plenty of beverage service. Didn't get a choice of meal but sitting in the back is a quieter and less crowded cabin. There was no noise or inconvenience from the rear lavs or galley. Continental Connection (Colgan) flights on the little Saab were fine too.

Flew Continental from Houston to Guadalajara. Flight was cancelled due to no flight crew. Had a 4+ hour delay. Is this any way to run a company? I think not. Will continue to use this airline as they are only non-stop service but can't wait until Southwest has direct service thru Volaris.

We had a 48 hour delay in a 3rd rate hotel in Puerto Plata Dominican Republic. The subsequent equivalent Continental flights on 03/28/11 and 03/29/11 left on time while the passengers from the 03/27/11 flight remained on the ground. Obviously an alternate airplane was sent for those flights yet no such arrangement nor other arrangement was made for us. Two days represents a considerable expense and lost time to individual passengers as well as to our employers expecting our return to work. Another airplane should have been sent since ours had a mechanical failure. Our seats cost $1100 each because we booked only a month in advance (I have flown much further for much less and arrived on time). The closest thing we got to compensation was a $12 food voucher for use at Newark Airport! I think this experience proves that Continental is uninterested in their passenger's needs. I will do my best to avoid flying Continental again.

LFT-IAH-MCO. The LFT-IAH flight operated by a Continental Express ERJ-145 was delayed 2.5 hours due to weather. This meant had only 12 minutes to change terminals at IAH and connect to our flight to MCO. Fortunately Continental held our connecting flight so I made it just barely. IAH-MCO on B757-300 in first class. Dinner quite good as was red wine selection. Seats comfortable and service great. My checked bag actually made it as well so I was quite pleased in view of the earlier delay due to weather.

Continental is the most egregious of all airlines when it comes to adding hundreds of dollars in fees for items that used to be free and every time I fly the fees keep going up. Thank goodness my company pays for travel but $120 RT for baggage $188 RT for exit row seats $18 RT for meals - all of which used to be free - is simply egregious. As others said the crew is never very nice and you feel like they are merely trying to tolerate the passengers. I say if they don't like people they shouldn't be in the service industry. I am writing this while on hold with their customer service. First I was on hold for 15 minutes someone picked up by saying "hello" and nothing else. I asked for a receipt for the extra legroom and she said "Let me transfer you to the correct department" and now I'm back on hold for 10 minutes already. Maybe I'll be on hold for another 15 minutes which will make 35 minutes total to get a receipt sent to me. I checked online and a receipt for extra legroom is not available. Continental has a virtual monopoly on Newark Airport in NJ and they take full advantage of it.

Flew with them for the first time from Dublin to New York. Plane out was delayed by 3 and a half hours because the cover for one of the emergency exit lights was missing! We were told for 1 hour that the delay was due to the ongoing servicing of the plane then they finally admitted what the problem was. It took over an hour for a new plastic cover to be sourced and a further hour to get the cover and get us onboard. Then on the way back we were 2 hours delayed because the plane we were getting had been sitting in a different terminal all day and had to be brought over to our gate. God forbid they might plan ahead and get the plane over earlier so that we actually took off on time!

SAN-IAH-AMS BRU-EWR-IAH-SAN return. Domestic segments on B737-800. IAH-AMS on B767-400ER. BRU-EWR on B777-200ER. Planes clean and in good repair service professional and friendly food above average and baggage arrived with me. DirectTV on domestic flights a plus older IFE on B767 adequate AVOD on B777 excellent. New lie-flat seats on B777 very comfortable.

Continental has gone to the dogs. They publish rules for one pass members but don't follow them. Today I tried to book a flight for February 2012. I called at exactly 1 minute after midnite Houston time. I was put on hold for 1 hour and 50 minutes. I used other phones to call other continental numbers and got recordings saying that their call volume was too high and they could not take my call. At 3am I finally got a real person who said there were no seats on February 15 16 or 17 for One Pass members. I could call back in a few days. This was on the heels of having cancelled one cruise because Continental could get me to Buenos Aires but they could not get me home. It is obvious that they purposely ignore their own rules so that you cannot use acquired miles.

Just taken a return flight from UK to Newark USA. We paid extra for return flights with extra legroom. We thought this well worthwhile (757 row 21). We were pleasantly surprised by the amount of room and felt the box underneath the seat in front was not a real problem. My gripe with Continental on both outward and return (and you will see this in lots of comments on this site) is our dissatisfaction with cabin crew. They are discourteous arrogant to a very high level and so full of their own importance that is almost incredulous. I for one will never use this airline again.

The worst airline I have used. Flew return UK to Mexico via USA. Cabin crew are the rudest I have met unable to answer questions politely. Found a passenger sitting in one of our seats on inbound flight - crew refused to remove that person so we were forced to sit apart and called "pathetic" for wanting to sit in our allocated seats. Told by another crew member they didn't have time to tell us what the drinks options were when we asked. Really poor service all round.

BHX-EWR-PTY return SJO-EWR-BHX - best and cheapest way of doing this routing. Booking this multi leg and class trip on web site was easy with seat selection at booking no problem - much better than almost all others for odd routes and fare very competitive. Smooth trip both ways with 3 seats for two of us. Also booking business on one leg gets lounge access and early boarding for the other leg - as long as both trips are international.
